1:
The plans of the heart belong to a person,\q but from Yahweh comes the answer from his tongue.
\q
2:
All of a person's ways are pure in his own eyes,\q but Yahweh weighs the spirits.


\q
3:
Commit your works to Yahweh\q and your plans will succeed.
\q
4:
Yahweh has made everything for its purpose,\q even the wicked for the day of trouble.


\q
5:
Yahweh hates everyone who has an arrogant heart,\q but be sure of this, they will not go unpunished.
\q
6:
By covenant faithfulness and trustworthiness iniquity is atoned for\q and by the fear of Yahweh people turn away from evil.


\q
7:
When a person's ways are pleasing to Yahweh,\q he makes even that person's enemies to be at peace with him.
\q
8:
Better is a little with what is right,\q than a large income with injustice.


\q
9:
In his heart a person plans out his way,\q but Yahweh directs his steps.
\q
10:
Insightful decisions are on the lips of a king,\q his mouth should not betray justice. 

\q
11:
Honest scales come from Yahweh;\q all the weights in the bag are his work.
\q
12:
When kings do wicked things, that is something to be despised,\q for a throne is established by doing what is right.


\q
13:
A king delights in lips that say what is right\q and he loves the one who speaks directly.
\q
14:
A king's wrath is a messenger of death\q but a wise man will try to calm his anger.

\q
15:
In the light of a king's face is life\q and his favor is like a cloud that brings a spring rain.
\q
16:
How much better it is to get wisdom than gold.\q To get understanding should be chosen more than silver.


\q
17:
The highway of upright people turns away from evil;\q the one who protects his life guards his way.
\q
18:
Pride comes before destruction\q and a haughty spirit before a downfall.


\q
19:
It is better to be humble among poor people\q than to divide the spoil with proud people.
\q
20:
Whoever contemplates what they are taught will find what is good,\q and those who trust in Yahweh will be blessed.

\q
21:
The one who is wise in heart is called discerning\q and sweetness of speech improves the ability to teach.
\q
22:
Understanding is a fountain of life to the one who has it,\q but the instruction of fools is their foolishness.


\q
23:
The heart of a wise person gives insight to his mouth\q and adds persuasiveness to his lips.
\q
24:
Pleasant words are a honeycombâ€”\q sweet to the soul and healing to the bones.


\q
25:
There is a way that seems right to a man,\q but its end is the way to death.
\q
26:
The laborer's appetite works for him;\q his hunger urges him on.

\q
27:
A worthless person digs up mischief\q and his speech is like a scorching fire.
\q
28:
A perverse person stirs up conflict\q and a gossip separates close friends.


\q
29:
A man of violence lies to his neighbor\q and leads him down a path that is not good.
\q
30:
The one who winks the eye is plotting perverse things;\q those who purse the lips will bring evil to pass.


\q
31:
Gray hair is a crown of glory;\q it is gained by living the right way.
\q
32:
It is better to be slow to anger than to be a warrior\q and one who rules his spirit is stronger than one who conquers a city.


\q
33: The lots are cast into the lap,\q but the decision is from Yahweh.
